sep.gaia.util

Interface BoundingBox

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FloatBoundingBox, IntegerBoundingBox

    public interface BoundingBox
    Interface for a general 2-dimensional rectangle, of which the corners are represented by instances of classes that implement Vector3D. Because the modeled rectangle is 2-dimensional, the z-coordinate of each vector representing a corner of this bounding box is 0.
    Author:
    Max Witzelsperger

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3D getLowerLeft()
      Gets the lower left coordinate.
      Vector3D getLowerRight()
      Gets the lower right coordinate.
      Vector3D getUpperLeft()
      Gets the upper left coordinate of this.
      Vector3D getUpperRight()
      Gets the upper right coordinate.
      void setLowerRight(Vector3D lowerRight)
      Sets the lower right coordinate if the argument lowerRight together with the current upper left coordinate upperLeft of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight.
      void setUpperLeft(Vector3D upperLeft)
      Sets the upper left coordinate if the argument upperLeft together with the current lower right coordinate lowerRight of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight.

    • Method Detail

      • getUpperLeft

        Vector3D getUpperLeft()
        Gets the upper left coordinate of this.
        Returns:
        the upper left coordinate in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate is 0

      • setUpperLeft

        void setUpperLeft(Vector3D upperLeft)
        Sets the upper left coordinate if the argument upperLeft together with the current lower right coordinate lowerRight of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight. Otherwise the invocation of this method is without effect.
        Parameters:
        upperLeft - the new value for the upper left coordinate in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate is assumed to be 0 and is otherwise ignored

      • getLowerRight

        Vector3D getLowerRight()
        Gets the lower right coordinate.
        Returns:
        the lower right coordinate in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate is 0

      • setLowerRight

        void setLowerRight(Vector3D lowerRight)
        Sets the lower right coordinate if the argument lowerRight together with the current upper left coordinate upperLeft of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight. Otherwise the invocation of this method is without effect.
        Parameters:
        lowerRight - the new value for the lower right coordinate in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate is assumed to be 0 and is otherwise ignored

      • getUpperRight

        Vector3D getUpperRight()
        Gets the upper right coordinate.
        Returns:
        the upper right coordinate in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate is 0
